Code Documentation#

Check out the Usage section for information on how to run the code, including how to install the project.

App#

Bar Bending Scheduler#

class BarBendingScheduler.BarBendingScheduler#

A class which handles the creation of a BBS (CSV) based on a given DXF file

createBarQuantitiesCsv(dxf_path, csv_path=None)#

creates a BBS in CSV format based on a given DXF file

Parameters:

  • dxf_path (string) – The path to the DXF to read

  • csv_path (string) – The path to save the CSV (default is ‘{dxf_path}-BBS-output.csv’)

Dxf Handler#

class DxfHandler.DxfHandler#

A class which handles manipulation of DXF files (read and write)

get_all_mtext(dxf_file_path)#

Get all the mtext entities within a dxf file

Parameters:

dxf_file_path (string) – The path to the DXF file

Returns:

A group of all mtext components found in modelspace

Return type:

exdxf.query.EntityQuery

get_all_mtext_text(dxf_file_path)#

Get all the text attributes of any mtext entities within a dxf file (all text including formatting returned)

Parameters:

dxf_file_path (string) – The path to the DXF file

Returns:

A list of all the text found in modelspace

Return type:

list of str

get_text_att(mtext)#

Get the text attribute of a mtext entity

Parameters:

mtext (ezdxf.entities.mtext.MText) – The mtext entity

Returns:

The mtext text contents

Return type:

string

Label Parser#

class LabelParser.LabelParser#

A class which handles parsing of strings

filter_strings_with_pattern(string_list: str, pattern: str) → list#

filter strings using regex pattern given

Parameters:

  • string_list (list of str) – The text to parse

  • pattern (list of str) – The regex pattern to filter with

Returns:

A list of filtered strings that exactly match the pattern

Return type:

list of str

get_bars(text: list) → list#

get all bars as dicts (bar_mark, type, size and quantity)

H bar size only

Parameters:

text (list of str) – The text to parse

Returns:

A list of bars

Return type:

list of dict

Bar Handler#

class BarHandler.BarHandler#

A class which handles the creation of Bar Dicts

are_elements_equal(group: list) → bool#

Check if all elements in a list are equal

i.e [8,8] = True, [8,16] = False

Parameters:

group (list of elements) – The list to check

Returns:

A bool stating if all elements in the list are the same

Return type:

bool

get_bar_set(bars: list) → list#

return a unique set of bars with the quantities stored as a list

Parameters:

bars (list of bar dicts) – The bars list containing duplicate bar marks

Returns:

A list of unique bars with their updated quantities

Return type:

bar_set (list)

sum_quantities(original_bar_set: list) → list#

Sum up each bars’ quantities list into No. of Mbars, No. of bars in each

i.e [8,8] = 2, 8 or [8,16] = 1, 24

Parameters:

bars (list of unique bars) – The bars list containing quantity list

Returns:

A list of unique bars with ‘number_of_members’ and ‘number_of_bars_in_each’ added

Return type:

bar_set_formatted (list)

Csv Handler#

class CsvHandler.CsvHandler#

A class which handles manipulation of CSV files (read and write)

csv_to_dict_list(csv_file_path: str) → list#

Reads in a csv file to a list of dicts

Parameters:

csv_file_path (string,) – The path to the CSV file

Returns:

data – A list of dicts read in from file

Return type:

list of dicts

dict_list_to_csv(list_to_csv: list, keys: list = None, csv_file_path: str = 'output.csv') → None#

Outputs a list of dicts to a csv file

Parameters:

  • list_to_csv (list of dicts) – The list of dictionaries to save

  • keys (list of str, optional) – The keys to save

  • csv_file_path (string, optional) – The path to the CSV file save location
